title: MEAS CIV_ENV 395-0-25 Special Topics in Civil and Environmental Engrg
topic: Water in Israel and the Middle East: Geopolitical

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Water in Israel and the Middle East: Geopolitical Conflicts, Technological Challenges, and Sustainable Solutions

The course will provide an overview of the climatic and geographical limitations on water availability in Israel and the Middle East, discuss ancient and modern societal responses to these limitations, and define opportunities for development of sustainable solutions for regional stability and prosperity. OPEN TO SENIORS AND GRADUATE STUDENTS.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Must be seniors or graduate students.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The course will provide an overview of the climatic and geographical limitations on water availability in Israel and the Middle East, discuss ancient and modern societal responses to these limitations, and define opportunities for development of sustainable solutions for regional stability and prosperity.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Students will read relevant selections from the literature each week, prepare a brief position paper exploring one major aspect of each set of readings, and participate in a structured, in-depth discussion of major themes by critically evaluating and cross-comparing the positions that each student articulated in their position papers. The course explicitly cross-cuts historical, social, geopolitical, scientific, and technological themes, so students are expected to lead discussions within their primary domain(s) of interest and contribute to broader class discussions of cross-cutting themes.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Pearce, Fred. When the rivers run dry: Water, the defining crisis of the twenty-first century. Beacon Press, 2006.

Siegel, Seth M. Let There Be Water: Israel's Solution for a Water-Starved World. Macmillan, 2015.
(continued)

Amery, Hussein A., and Aaron T. Wolf, eds. Water in the Middle East: A geography of peace. University of Texas Press, 2010.

Jerusalem Archaeological Sites: Biblical Water Systems, Jewish Virtual Library, https://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/Archaeology/jerwater.html

Selections from the current literature on water resources, climate change, and emerging water technologies in Israel and the Middle East.
